documents.document: Was SO good to be back at @bcplace for #CanWNT today. March 2 can't come soon enough! https://t.co/5jfrcFxEYP
Ugh. Maybe I am turning into a cranky old lady, but stop it with the wave and watch #CanWNT, people.
I gripe to my mom about heading to the #CanWNT game in this weather. Her: "This used to be a normal winter weekend for you". Fair point.
Tucked in at home away from the snow and streaming #Sydney7s - has me so excited to be at @canadasevens in March.
Appalling. It continues to feel like we have suddenly started living in an alternative universe. These are vetted… https://t.co/Ywt0b5czWI
Damn right. Though it is quite entertaining to watch. https://t.co/VyiBmulGVX

Well done. Would be nice to see @hudsonsbay follow suit. https://t.co/3gzDvEvWNZ
@marcdweber I was kinda hoping there was a secret new Vancouver sports website afoot.

Wow, this is an epic find. https://t.co/6YpQLQO790
"He has plans to carry his sinister associate Bear Bear with him...and we know how Betsy DeVos feels about bears in… https://t.co/6R9xWBGYFC
@ProvinceWeber "My parting wish is that you get a DP striker before I get a new job." Nice thought, but hopefully both happen rapidly. :)
Horrid day for #VWFC journos. Very much value and will miss @provinceweber, @PeteSchaad and @ScottRintoul's work. Hope to see you soon.
No. You can't spew the Islamophobic vitriol you do, then try to get credit for publicly mourning this tragedy. https://t.co/bvhitm0oaX
So many things about the #MuslimBan have been horrifying, but this article highlights one appalling aspect. https://t.co/8SlkUDQJwf
Well said. Dammit, now I have to give a #TFC player credit for something. Feels so wrong. https://t.co/46sbshOj69
This (Bannon-fueled?) nonsense shouldn't be overlooked amidst today's #MuslimBan chaos. https://t.co/gXesd0M2Ct
Watching the #AusOpen over the past two weeks has really made me want to go back to Melbourne. What an amazing par… https://t.co/w28PJ28kSE
This is amazing. WANT. (Except it would not stay frozen here in Vancouver.) https://t.co/uNuHdzdenT via @HuffPostCanada
Makes me extra-proud to be Canadian. Yay for facts and logic. https://t.co/obA4fVKyk0
@annanamshirin Apparently not. Don't want to give that clickbait vitriol the attention it seeks, but it's so vital to keep speaking out.
@annanamshirin Wow. Didn't think much could surprise me any more, but that's attained an extra level of offensive.
Saw the sign at Starbucks for the #CascaraLatte today and my first thought was "isn't that a laxative?" Unfortunate shared name.😬
This marvellous speech makes the contrast with his successor even more glaring. Pretty darn pointed, too. https://t.co/DhUewV7Ee6
@bcplace So good! Will there be pre-sale access for VWFC season ticket holders like for most shows?
Co-signed. Though my #CanWNT bias may be showing. https://t.co/mvfyxj0bZi
Amazing speech, and even more impressive that she took the moment of her lifetime achievement award to give it. https://t.co/N4Au7tLRpH
Got home late from work and could hear the #WorldJuniors OT through just about every door on my way down the hall. How very Canadian.
@salishsea86 Fun live soccer, inexpensive time out with friends, have now gotten overly emotionally invested . . .
So well-done. Apparently this dangerous crackpot thinks that a list of carcinogens should include "bras, carbs, ta… https://t.co/lPb9oFAK20
@annanamshirin @CP_CNC It's true - if the city spent millions on snow/ice equipment that it only used rarely there would be a fuss too.
@CP_CNC @annanamshirin I'd like to think that the people taking extra are using it to salt sidewalks for elderly neighbours. Maybe?
@aftncanada I want ALL the nice things, dammit. Would love it if WFC2 moved a bit more centrally, though (since it's all about me).
Well, it is Orthodox Christmas on Friday . . . https://t.co/CYCL9cjWPL
Woot. About time! https://t.co/7uZkKlwblo
Either I missed it until now, or Shaw On Demand recently added the HBO back-catalogue. Either way, it's time for a Band of Brothers rewatch.
A nice sliver of year-end optimism. https://t.co/iAPcpmLDb3
There are many things I love about YVR. The molasses-slow speed of the luggage return isn't one of them. So close to being home, but so far.
Was expecting to battle through stressed people at Pearson, but people have been MORE kind/helpful than usual. Score one for holiday spirit.
My goodness, @wecomefromaway was terrific. Left me feeling more hopeful about the world than the rest of 2016 combined. Good luck in NYC!
Would really like one of my sports teams to make an exciting off-season acquisition soon-ish. Sure would be a nice Christmas present. 😬
Had a pretty excellent Christmas tea with my mama at the Prince of Wales in Niagara-on-the-Lake. Thanks,… https://t.co/GIFf7M9Y8i
Anonymous call: "It's been cold, so someone will come in to your house to check your pipes and water quality. What's your address?" Yikes.
@annanamshirin The Champions - about the rescuing and rehab of some of Michael Vick's dogs.
People of Vancouver - clean the snow off the back of your car! Can't believe how many I saw covered in snow this AM.
@annanamshirin Thanks! I wanted new Christmas baking recipes this year and whiskey chocolate Christmas cookies sound close to perfection.
@annanamshirin Oh my goodness, is the recipe for the whiskey cookies online?
Need to do some Christmas baking tonight (in my still tree-less apartment) to put me back in a good mood.
Grr. Turns out the "in stock" Christmas tree I ordered from @SearsCA is back-ordered and they didn't bother to notify me.
I never need an extra reason to dislike the Yankees, but (even expected as it is) this doesn't hurt. https://t.co/QoYriQUDDA
"On the Nature of Daylight" STILL in my head from Sat. Eventually remembered this brilliant mix from Shutter Island: https://t.co/oPdEwk87fA
"Next time you're thinking about publishing a cherry-picked article, try consulting a scientist first." Way to go,… https://t.co/bsHMpXqB1Q
Lovely farewell letter. I will really miss seeing him drop a 40-yard pass on a dime. #ThankYouPedro https://t.co/88xLin0iBi
@jasonbrauer @markjrdailey Seems unfair to call Pedro a failed DP - was a highly skilled player who was a difference-maker when on his game.
@annanamshirin Online's better than real life for me. Most recently: "Good for you for knowing that!" from a co-worker while talking soccer.
I enjoy how many people in Vancouver use their umbrellas in the snow. I guess it works?
@MissStaceyMay *cue obligatory Dumb and Dumber GIF* https://t.co/LFPCP5Lm9Q
@JeffDSalisbury Might be my favourite movie of the year so far.
@JeffDSalisbury It was different from what I expected in a great way - much more about communication and life than big bad aliens.
Yesterday: found a scotch I've been hunting for, did lots of Christmas shopping AND saw (the terrific) Arrival. Today can only go downhill.

"I kind of wanted to play forward, but Coach didn't let me. I got over it."
Good thing for Canada that she did. :) https://t.co/HfFQAOMGTK
Ashanti and Ja Rule reunited for the Hamilton Mixtape? This is giving me all sorts of high school feels. https://t.co/A3CgkY7BlC
REALLY going to miss the perfect coffee + breakfast in Melbourne - one of the many Aussies in Vancouver really needs to get that going here.
Had a moment of "wait, WHAT!?!?" with this. Then realized that they're talking about Karl, not Carl. Whew. #VWFC https://t.co/boBOcYrzrg
@AidanRantoul I think so . . . MLS for sure.
Pfft. Got nothin' on (then) (say it with me) 15-year-old Alphonso Davies. #VWFC https://t.co/EKHmd1CKuB
The dislike of Melbourne street artists for Donald Trump is strong and enjoyable. https://t.co/MtrQzrseAd
This spot isn’t half-bad either. https://t.co/4ATmT724fH
So . . . Australia is not exactly hideous. https://t.co/P5ayYMMhw1
I am loving Australia so far, but seeing Christmas decorations and hearing holiday music in 30C weather feels deeply weird.
Unexpectedly met another Canadian #BlueJays fan on the Sydney Harbour Bridge today when we saw each others' hats. We're everywhere!
#MeanwhileInCanada This sort of feels like seeing your cousin about to have a terrible drunken hookup at a wedding.
Just bought tickets to see @wecomefromaway when I am in Toronto for Christmas and I. Cannot. Wait.
Thought I was through the stages of grief to acceptance re: the #VWFC season, but watching playoffs has me back between anger & depression.
@annanamshirin Yes. Often also the "stop driving like a moron" death stare. They may not often see it, but it makes ME feel better.
Speaking of those #jessieflemingthings . . . wowza. https://t.co/HHKQg4lg0G
I like the idea of getting #jessieflemingthings going. https://t.co/dulofwAApC

@EqualizerSoccer I will forever appreciate her role in this bit of brilliance: https://t.co/JekGbWyZu9
Me, to a friend I am about to visit in Australia: "What can I bring you?" Her: "Kraft Dinner!" Doesn't get much more Canadian than that.
@aftncanada A little piece of me is delighted imagining faces in the MLS offices coping w/the prospect of a TFC vs. Impact conference final.
@BlueJaysDad Who spells it "tuque"? Never seen that before.
Fascinated by the strongly worded negative responses from Dynamo players to the Wade Barrett non-hire. More outspoken than we often see.
"We don't know who we WANT to be our coach, but we know that we don't want you". Ouch. https://t.co/WBtPQZuzmq
@GlassCityFC @annanamshirin @CapsOffside @downtowntbrown_ By that argument you could say this year's 7 points below wasn't far off playoffs.
Man. I would actually rather the Cubs win the #WorldSeries, but there's something satisfying about seeing a non-#BlueJays team get Millered.

You know I love you, #VWFC, but I might have to take it a bit personally that you saved this show for the game I had to miss for work.
Well, that's just charming. https://t.co/yKDiWz65rM via @HuffPostPol

@jnemec Not surprised given that everyone charges for playoffs/knockouts, but kinda crummy since we are getting two fewer games next season.
🔥👏 Well played, HRC. https://t.co/EZvFcAEsR3
@markjrdailey Me to, actually. Score one for Timmy-the-mediator?
Video of yesterday's practice tiff. #ImWithOusted #VWFC https://t.co/ndNr2KG67k
@timandsid Poor form to air that hatchet job on Dickey. Reasoned critique is fine but that was rude and disrespectful. #BlueJays
